CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT- ASSISTANT
Professional Summary
Experienced professional with 10+ years experience in Project Management with a background in Real Estate, Residential, Commercial, Civil, Contract Management, project Coordination, Procurement, Business development and other facets of the Construction industry.
Demonstrated verifiable success leading multi-million dollar organizations through start-up, revitalization, and accelerated growth.
Solutions — driven , decisive and results-oriented with outstanding negotiation and crisis management skills.
Seeking an opportunity to leverage leadership, management, and business development skills to become a top-level construction manager.

SKILLS

Project Management Budget & Finances Personnel Acquisition & Training Team Management Customer Relations Site Management
New Business Development Value Engineering Procurement Oral and written communication Business writing

Company Name
— City , State
Assisted in supervision of all on-site construction which included scheduling of sub — contractors , ordering materials, obtaining permits, resolving problems at job site, and inspecting construction work to ensure compliance with plans and specifications Assisted with Performed tests on aggregate production, asphalt mix, and ready-mix concrete Assisted with inspections on newly built lift stations and city pavement work Analyzed and orchestrated Bids on new city civil projects worth $20,000,000 Actively sought out potential upcoming bids for submission Attended pre-bid meetings On-boarded subcontractors Led weekly production and operations sub- contractor meetings, facilitating stronger communication and helping to resolve critical issues Assisted vice president of production in review, approval and archiving of all closeout documents Obtained building and specialty permits from local jurisdictional agencies Monitored subcontractor operations and applied effective time, resource and money management strategies to delivery under-budget project completion. Decreased budget by 23%

<JD_START>
Job Title: Project Engineer

Location: Houston, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
As the Project Engineer for Sustaining Capex Projects, you will manage and execute projects through all phases from project budget and development, through construction, commissioning, and completion, within budget, schedule, regulatory requirements, and industry accepted practices, as well as leading others as appropriate.
 Your Core Responsibilities:· Onsite project engineer supporting with onsite construction management.· Provide a project engineering service between consultant, contractor and internal stakeholders throughout all projects within your scope.· Review and make professional judgement on designs based on company Standards.· Ensure project is carried out in accordance with the Project Management (VPM) requirements, regulatory and statutory requirements.· Demonstrating excellent stakeholder management skills· Perform project development including project scope, cost estimate and schedule.· Familiar with project FEL process for project identification and option selection.· Onsite construction management through all phases, coordinate with Operations to develop operations, maintenance, and start-up procedures.· Develop material/construction bid packages for soliciting material/contractor bids, and eventual project execution (including drawings, specifications, work scopes and schedules).· Lead external multi-disciplinary teams and serve as a technical leader.· Apply economic evaluations such as cost savings, profit improvements and operational improvements to optimize project output.· Provide technical guidance to operating personnel.· Lead project incident investigations.· Communicate project progress and results in a concise and understandable manner.· Support the Department’s safety, health, and environmental policies.· Be a pro-active leader in safety matters· Act as the Initiator and/or Reviewer for any documentation or equipment changes within your scope by using the established Management of Change process.· Prepare reports for presentation to internal customers including, but not limited to, senior management.· Responsible for submitting purchase requests and receiving goods and services in the procurement system and complete necessary paperwork to ensure timely processing of invoices for payment.· Perform other duties as assigned by management that fall within the generally expected scope of this position.
Qualifications:· Required minimum 5 years relevant job experience.· Required bachelor’s Degree in Civil, Mechanical and Electrical Engineering or similar field of study.· Working knowledge of PHMSA Part 195, ASME B31.3/4, API 650/653, and NFPA along with the requirements and design criteria contained in these documents.· Must possess strong communications, analytical, and organizational and skills for· working with all levels within the organization.· Proficient computer skills, including word processing, spreadsheet calculations, project scheduling and presentation development within Microsoft Office applications.· Preferred prior experience in chemical storage terminals in the following areas: o Mechanical – Piping, Valves, Metering, Hydraulics, Pumps/Seal Systemso Civil – Foundations, Tanks, Supports, Marine Structureso Electrical – Automation, Controls, Instrumentation, Motors, Power· Ability and willingness to travel as required (est. 25%) and be self-motivated.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
